CSRmeshResult TimeSetState (CsrUint8 nw_id, CsrUint16 dest_id, CSRMESH_TIME_SET_STATE_T *p_params)
 Setting Time Broadcast Interval: Upon receiving a TIME_SET_STATE message, the device saves the TimeInterval field into the appropriate state value. It then responds with a TIME_STATE message with the current state information. More...

CSRmeshResult TimeSetTime (CsrUint8 nw_id, CsrUint16 dest_id, CSRMESH_TIME_SET_TIME_T *p_params)
 Setting Current Local Time: Upon receiving a TIME_SET_TIME message, the device sets the CurrentTime to the CurrentTime field of the message. This message is deprecated; it should only be used when a device cannot wait for a time broadcast. More...
 
CSRmeshResult TimeGetTime (CsrUint8 nw_id, CsrUint16 dest_id, CSRMESH_TIME_GET_TIME_T *p_params)
 Wallclock broadcast interval: Upon receiving a TIME_GET_TIME message, the device responds with the TIME_TIME message. The CurrentTime is set to the current local time. The SenderTTL field is set to the TTL value used by the initial sender of this message. The difference between the CurrentTime, as known by this device, and the CurrentTime field in the TIME_GET_TIME message divided by the subtraction of the TTL of the received message and the SenderTTL is placed into the RttPerHop field of the TIME_TIME message. This message is deprecated; it should only be used when a device cannot wait for a time broadcast. More...
